clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Novel Edible Gel-based Artificial Saliva in Thai Geriatric Populations With Systemic Diseases
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Novel Edible Gel-based Artificial Saliva in Thai Geriatric Populations With Systemic Diseases

lead_sponsor.agency: Dental Innovation Foundation Under Royal Patronage

clinical_study.source: Dental Innovation Foundation Under Royal Patronage

brief_summary.textblock: Elderly people usually have systemic diseases and take medications that can cause dry mouth. The purpose of this study is to determine whether continuous use of edible, gel-based artificial saliva in geriatric population with dry mouth problems will reduce signs and symptoms of dry mouth and improve quality of patients' saliva.

detailed_description.textblock: A pre-post test trial was conducted in 120 elders with xerostomia. All subjects received a total of 50 ml (10ml x 5 times) OMJ per day. Subjective and objective dry mouth scores, salivary pH, buffering capacity and satisfaction were monitored at 2 weeks and 1 month use, compared to baseline. The data were analyzed by Repeated Measure ANOVA.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in subjective dry mouth score
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 2 weeks and 4 weeks after intervention
primary_outcome.description: The outcome measure (subjective dry mouth score) will be measured before and 2 and 4 weeks after continuous usage of edible gel-based artificial saliva (30-50 ml/day for at least 5 days per week)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in objective dry mouth score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 2 weeks and 4 weeks after intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The outcome measure will be measured before and 2 and 4 weeks after continuous usage of edible gel-based artificial saliva (30-50 ml/day for at least 5 days per week)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in salivary Potential of Hydrogen ion (pH)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 2 weeks and 4 weeks after intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The outcome measure will be measured before and 2 and 4 weeks after continuous usage of edible gel-based artificial saliva (30-50 ml/day for at least 5 days per week)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 2 weeks and 4 weeks after intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The outcome measure will be measured before and 2 and 4 weeks after continuous usage of edible gel-based artificial saliva (30-50 ml/day for at least 5 days per week)

secondary_outcome.measure: Satisfaction of the edible gel-based artificial saliva
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the first day of trial
secondary_outcome.description: All subjects will try a few spoon of the edible gel based saliva and a commercially available inedible gel-based saliva. Then, all subjects will be interviewed for satisfaction of both products and compare the results.

arm_group.description: Continuous oral intake of edible gel-based artificial saliva (30-50 ml/day) for four weeks

intervention.description: Gel-based artificial saliva is a novel gel-like, edible moisturizing gel designed to relieve dry mouth.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have systemic diseases such as hypertension or diabetes mellitus and take medications that can cause dry mouth
- Report symptoms of dry mouth
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with uncontrolled systemic diseases
- Subjects who aspirate upon eating
- Subjects who smoke
- Subjects who are allergic to component of the intervention
